info.title: SoundCloud Public API Specification
info.description: Swagger json can be found [here](https://developers.soundcloud.com/docs/api/explorer/api.json) Cookie manager

tags.name: me
tags.description: Own User Endpoints. Requires an access token obtained via the authorization_code flow (resource owner required).

tags.name: search
tags.description: Search Endpoints. Supports access tokens from both authorization_code and client_credentials flows.

get.summary: Deprecated since 01.10.2024, please use https://secure.soundcloud.com/authorize instead. Use Authorize button in Swagger UI to see it in action.
get.description:
Security Advice

* [OAuth Authorization Code flow](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/draft-ietf-oauth-security-topics-16#section-2.1.1) (`response_type=code`) is the only allowed method of authorization. * Use the `state` parameter for [CSRF protection](https://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-ietf-oauth-security-topics-16#section-4.7). Pass a sufficient random nonce here and verify this nonce again after retrieving the token.

post.summary: Deprecated since 01.10.2024, please use https://secure.soundcloud.com/oauth/token instead. Use Authorize button in Swagger UI to see it in action.

get.summary: Returns the authenticated user’s information.
Returns the authenticated user's activities.
Recent the authenticated user's activities.
Returns the authenticated user's recent track related activities.
Returns a list of favorited or liked tracks of the authenticated user.
Returns a list of favorited or liked playlists of the authenticated user.
Returns a list of users who are followed by the authenticated user.
Returns a list of recent tracks from users followed by the authenticated user.
Returns a user who is followed by the authenticated user. (use /users/{user_urn} instead, to fetch the user details)

delete.summary: Deletes a user who is followed by the authenticated user.

get.summary: Returns a list of users who are following the authenticated user.
Returns a user who is following the authenticated user. (use /users/{user_urn} instead, to fetch the user details)
Returns user’s playlists (sets).
get.description: Returns playlist info, playlist tracks and tracks owner info.

get.summary: Returns a list of user's tracks.
Performs a track search based on a query
Performs a playlist search based on a query
Performs a user search based on a query
Returns a playlist.
Returns tracks under a playlist.
Returns a collection of playlist's reposters.
Returns a track.
Returns a track's streamable URLs (needs to keep using authentication)
Returns the comments posted on the track(track_urn).

post.summary: Returns the newly created comment on success

timestamp.description: Timestamp of a comment. String or float representation is supported

get.summary: Returns a list of users who have favorited or liked the track.
Returns a collection of track's reposters.
Returns all related tracks of track on SoundCloud.
Resolves soundcloud.com and on.soundcloud.com URLs to Resource URLs to use with the API.
Returns a user.
Returns a list of user's favorited or liked tracks. (use /users/:userId/likes/tracks instead, to fetch a user's likes)
Returns a list of user’s followers.
get.description: Returns a list of users that follows (user_urn).

get.summary: Returns a list of user’s followings.
get.description: Returns list of users that (user_urn) follows.

get.summary: Returns a user's following. (use /users/{user_urn} instead, to fetch the user details)
Returns a list of user's playlists.
Returns a list of user's tracks.
Returns list of user's links added to their profile (website, facebook, instagram).
Returns a list of user's liked tracks.
Returns a list of user's liked playlists.

post.summary: Reposts a track as the authenticated user

delete.summary: Removes a repost on a track as the authenticated user

post.summary: Reposts a playlist as the authenticated user

delete.summary: Removes a repost on a playlist as the authenticated user

post.summary: invalidates session associated with current token

bpm.name: bpm
bpm.description: Return tracks with a specified bpm[from], bpm[to]

from.description: Return tracks with at least this bpm value

to.description: Return tracks with at most this bpm value

client_id.name: client_id
client_id.description: The client id belonging to your application

created_at.name: created_at
created_at.description: (yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss) return tracks created within the specified dates

from.description: (yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss) return tracks created at this date or later

to.description: (yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss) return tracks created at this date or earlier

duration.name: duration
duration.description: Return tracks within a specified duration range

from.description: Return tracks with at least this duration value

to.description: Return tracks with at most this duration value

genres.name: genres
genres.description: A comma separated list of genres

ids.name: ids
ids.description: A comma separated list of track ids to filter on

urns.name: urns
urns.description: A comma separated list of track urns to filter on

limit.name: limit
limit.description: Number of results to return in the collection.

offset.name: offset
offset.description: Offset of first result. Deprecated, use `linked_partitioning` instead.

redirect_uri.name: redirect_uri
redirect_uri.description: The redirect uri you have configured for your application

response_type.name: response_type
response_type.description: Support only the Authorization Code Flow

state.name: state
state.description: Any value included here will be appended to the redirect URI. Use this for CSRF protection.

tags.name: tags
tags.description: A comma separated list of tags

linked_partitioning.name: linked_partitioning
linked_partitioning.description: Returns paginated collection of items (recommended, returning a list without pagination is deprecated and should not be used)

secret_token.name: secret_token
secret_token.description: A secret token to fetch private playlists/tracks

access.name: access
access.description: Filters content by level of access the user (logged in or anonymous) has to the track. The result list will include only tracks with the specified access. Include all options if you'd like to see all possible tracks. See `Track#access` schema for more details.

access_explicit.name: access
access_explicit.description: Filters content by level of access the user (logged in or anonymous) has to the track. The result list will include only tracks with the specified access. Include all options if you'd like to see all possible tracks. See `Track#access` schema for more details.

show_tracks.name: show_tracks
show_tracks.description: A boolean flag to request a playlist with or without tracks. Default is `true`.

follower_urn.name: follower_urn
follower_urn.description: SoundCloud User id to denote a Follower

following_urn.name: following_urn
following_urn.description: SoundCloud User id to denote a Following of a user

AuthHeader.name: Authorization
AuthHeader.description: The string "OAuth" followed by the user’s token: OAuth ACCESS_TOKEN. Obtained in oAuth2.1 flow

oAuth2_1.description: This API uses OAuth2.1 with Authorization Code flow, Client Credential flow. When registering your app, for it to work with Swagger UI specify redirect url as https://developers.soundcloud.com/docs/api/explorer/oauth2-redirect.html. [More info](https://developers.soundcloud.com/docs/api/guide#authentication)

embeddable_by.description: who can embed this track "all", "me", or "none"

tag_list.description: The tag_list property contains a list of tags separated by spaces. Multiword tags are quoted in double quotes. We also support machine tags that follow the pattern NAMESPACE:KEY=VALUE. For example: geo:lat=43.555 camel:size=medium “machine:tag=with space” Machine tags are not revealed to the user on the track pages.

release_date.title: write only!
release_date.description: string, formatted as yyyy-mm-dd, representing release date

license.description: Possible values: no-rights-reserved, all-rights-reserved, cc-by, cc-by-nc, cc-by-nd, cc-by-sa, cc-by-nc-nd, cc-by-nc-sa

tracks.description: List of tracks to add to playlist

playlist[tracks][][urn].description: To pass multiple tracks, pass multiple comma-separated values, e.g. -F "playlist[tracks][][urn]=soundcloud:tracks:111,soundcloud:tracks:222"

playlist[artwork_data].title: The playlist artwork in binary format. Supported formats are gif, jpeg and png

track[embeddable_by].description: who can embed this track "all", "me", or "none"

track[tag_list].description: The tag_list property contains a list of tags separated by spaces. Multiword tags are quoted in double quotes. We also support machine tags that follow the pattern NAMESPACE:KEY=VALUE. For example: geo:lat=43.555 camel:size=medium “machine:tag=with space” Machine tags are not revealed to the user on the track pages.

track[release_date].title: write only!
track[release_date].description: string, formatted as yyyy-mm-dd, representing release date

track[license].description: Possible values: no-rights-reserved, all-rights-reserved, cc-by, cc-by-nc, cc-by-nd, cc-by-sa, cc-by-nc-nd, cc-by-nc-sa

track[artwork_data].title: Only for uploading, for PRO users

website_title.description: a custom title for the website

subscriptions.description: a list subscriptions associated with the user

recurring.description: if the subscription is recurring or not

comments_count.description: comments count. From now on, the field always has a `0` value.

subscriptions.description: a list subscriptions associated with the user

recurring.description: if the subscription is recurring or not

website_title.description: a custom title for the website.

metadata_artist.description: Optional artist name, when different from user.

user_favorite.description: Is user's favourite. It is only set when fetching search results or single track, otherwise it is false.

user_playback_count.description: Number of plays by a user.

available_country_codes.description: List of countries where track is available.

access.description:
Level of access the user (logged in or anonymous) has to the track.
  * `playable` - user is allowed to listen to a full track.
  * `preview` - user is allowed to preview a track, meaning a snippet is available
  * `blocked` - user can only see the metadata of a track, no streaming is possible

WebProfiles.description: User's links added to their profile

created_at.description: Timestamp of when the link was added to the profile.

username.description: Username extracted from the external link
